page.title: 05Post office, Sandridge
page.content: In Sandridge there are only 2 shops and 1 post office. Mr Auckland, the postmaster, is due to retire later this year.The Head post office decided that there was no point in getting someone else to take over the job and the post office was due to close. Local people were very angry about this because the old people of the village would have to go to St. Albans to collect their pensions, as would mothers with young children.The post office is a village meeting place; without it Sandridge would become even less of a village. There were many articles and letters in the newspapers. One parish councillor collected over 500 signatures for a petition. This was successful and so the post office will be retained at the end of the year.
